gettingstarted.content: Some REST services require authentication. Digital Commerce REST services are authenticated on secure and unsecured channels. This authentication can include the use of the WCToken and WCTrustedToken. To use REST services that require authentication, you must first get authentication data by using a supported identity services. After you obtain the authentication data, you must pass either the WCToken or WCTustedToken parameters, or both, within the HTTP header for every request that requires authentication. If a request is sent over HTTP, pass the WCToken parameter in the HTTP header. Do not pass the WCTrustedToken in HTTP requests, as the parameter value might display. Send both the WCToken and the WCTrustedToken parameters when the request is being sent over HTTPS. The Digital Commerce REST APIs can also use session cookies that are created by the Digital Commerce store runtime for authentication. These cookies allow you to mix requests to the Digital Commerce REST APIs and the Digital Commerce store runtime within the same user session. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/concepts/cwvrestauth.html
gettingstarted.name: Authentication

gettingstarted.content: Digital Commerce REST services support JSON and XML formats for input and output data by default. The default format is JSON. When an XML String is sent to a REST service, you must set Content-Type HTTP header to be "application/xml". The REST service converts the XML input data to the JSON format that is accepted by REST services. Therefore, your input XML format must follow a certain structure so that it can be transformed to the JSON object that is accepted by REST services. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/refs/rwvrestxmlformat.html
gettingstarted.name: Response formats

gettingstarted.content: Preview tokens are encrypted strings that encapsulates a set of preview options and restrictions on when and where the token can be used. Any user who is authorized to access your server and has a preview token, can complete preview actions in the same store for which that token is generated. See more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.developer.doc/concepts/cpvpreviewtoken.html
gettingstarted.name: Preview tokens

gettingstarted.content: Some Digital Commerce REST services require a request to be sent over HTTPS. Learn more here: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSZLC2_8.0.0/com.ibm.commerce.webservices.doc/concepts/cwvrestsecurity.html
gettingstarted.name: Secure Sockets Layer

info.description:
These services provide APIs related to marketing in either a B2B or B2C store. Use these classes to:
  • Get e-Marketing Spot data
  • Get customer segment data
  • Trigger marketing based on certain types of events
  • Get user marketing behavior data
info.title: IBM Digital Commerce Services - Marketing

tags.name: Spot
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to retrieve spot details.

tags.name: Event
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to trigger marketing based on certain types of events. For example, CategoryDisplay, ProductDisplay, or Search.

tags.name: Segment
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to retrieve the customer segment data

tags.name: User Behavior
tags.description: This class provides RESTful services to get and delete user behavior for marketing purposes.

MarketingSpot.description: Display the main ad on About Dress Designer page

marketingContentDescription.marketingText:
Kids' Stuff
Summer style is all about fun prints, bright colors, comfort, and durability. Stock up on our easy-to-wear and affordable fashions for kids. Spend $100* or more, and earn a $25 gift certificate.
*Before taxes. Gift certificates are redeemable on your next visit.
shop now

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Structure containing image map definition for marketing content.

source.description: HTML definition of the image map. This element is used when users want to define the whole image map directly using HTML.

area.description: Clickable area in the image map.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Structure containing optional properties related to marketing content to display.
Structure containing the marketing title to display in the e-marketing spot.

contentFormatName.description: Name of the type of the marketing content.

marketingContentImageMap.description: Image map definition for the image with clickable areas.

marketingSpotDataTitleId.description: Unique ID for the marketing content.

contentId.description: Unique ID of the marketing content.

marketingSpotDataTitleDataType.description: Type of data displayed in the marketing content.

marketingSpotDataTitleActivityID.description: The unique identifier of the activity that returned the data to be displayed in the e-marketing spot.

contentClickAction.description: Number of click actions of the marketing content. : "None", "Single"(URL) or "Multiple"(Image Map).

contentFormatId.description: Unique ID of the type of the marketing content.

contentStoreId.description: Identifier of the store associated with the marketing content.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Structure containing the clickable area of an image map.

url.description: Click action to be invoked when the area is clicked.

shape.description: Shape of the area. Three types of shape are supported: "rect" (Rectangle), "circle" (Circle) and "poly" (Polygon).

uniqueID.description: Unique ID of the image map area.

isInCustomeSegment.description: Is the specified customer in the specified segment.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Structure containing the allowed values for the attribute.

integerValue.description: Type definition for an IntegerValue attribute.

floatValue.description: Type definition for a FloatValue attribute.

attributeValue.description: Abstract attribute value for customer extension.

stringValue.description: Type definition for an StringValue attribute.

extendedValue.description: Name-value pairs for defining additional attribute values such as images and or attachments. Can also be used for customer extension.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Marketing event trigger. Note : all parameters specified beyond the schema are sent to the marketing event.

searchTerm.description: Search term. Stored in a comma-separated list of search strings.

marketingTrackingConsent.description: Marketing tracking consent, value can be 0 or 1.

filteredResultId.description: The unique identifier of the filtered result.

filteredResultFormat.description: The format of the filtered result.

marketingText.description: Marketing text of a marketing content.

language.description: Supported languages of a marketing content.

Empty.description: Empty model. Used as default value when no model is specified.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: The data to display in the e-marketing spot. This contains the data and the information about the activity that returned this data.

attachmentReferenceId.description: Unique identifier for the attachment reference.

contentFormatName.description: Name of the type of the marketing content.

standardPriceQualifier.description: A uniquely identifying number that identifies the standard price.

standardPriceQuantityUnit.description: Unit of measure for minimumQuantity and maximumQuantity.

xcatg_displayTemplate.description: The display template for the catalog group.

topCatalogGroup.description: Attribute indicating whether catalog group is a top-level catalog group.

attachementExternalId.description: External identifying name for the attachment target.

storeIdentifier.description: External store identifier for the catalog entry/catalog group.

navigationRelationship.description: Type definition for a navigational relationship

listPrice.description: List price associated with the catalog entry.

contentInputOption.description: The input options for the marketing content image map. Two options are support: "Area" means the image map is defined by individual area. "Source" means the image map is defined by HTML source code.

contentClickAction.description: Number of click actions of the marketing content. : "None", "Single"(URL) or "Multiple"(Image Map).

attachmentImage.description: Image path of the attachment relation usage.

contentUrl.description: Click action to be invoked when marketing content on the page is clicked.

standardPriceContractID.description: Contract identifier the standard price is associated with.

baseMarketingSpotActivityID.description: Unique identifier for the data displayed in the e-marketing spot.

attachmentUsageDescription.description: Language or locale specific description of an attachment.

attachementStoreExternalId.description: External identifier of the store that owns the attachment.

contentMimeType.description: MIME type of the marketing content.

activityPriority.description: Priority of the activity that returned the	data to be displayed in the e-marketing spot.

parentCatalogGroupId.description: Parent catalog group identifier. Null for top-level catalog groups.

sEOURL.description: SEO URL associated with the catalog entry / catalog group.

attachmentReferenceDescription.description: Description of the relationship between the business object and the attachment.

xcatg_rootDirectory.description: The root directory for the catalog group.

ownerId.description: Owner organization of the catalog entry/catalog group.

taxonomyAttribute.description: Taxonomy attributes for the catalog group.

attachmentDisplaySequence.description: Sequence of the attachment relation usage.

contentFormatId.description: Unique ID of the type of the marketing content.

baseMarketingSpotCampaignName.description: Name of the campaign that returned the data to be displayed in the e-marketing spot

contentStoreId.description: Identifier of the store associated with the marketing content.

activityFormat.description: Type of the activity that returned the data to be displayed in the e-marketing spot.

baseMarketingSpotDataType.description: Type of the data displayed in the e-marketing spot.

sEOProperties.description: SEO properties associated with the catalog entry / catalog group.

contentId.description: Unique ID of the marketing content.

displaySequence.description: Sequence of display of catalog entry.

attachementStoreId.description: Identifier of the store that owns the attachment.

productPartNumber.description: Part number or SKU for the product.

baseMarketingSpotActivityName.description: Name of the data displayed in the e-marketing spot.

contentStoreExternalId.description: Unique external identifier of the store associated with the marketing content.

searchTerms.description: Encoded list of all the search terms.

attachmentAssetLanguage.description: Language ID for the language-specific fields in this input file.

attachmentLocalAsset.description: Attribute to indicate whether this attachment is a local attachment.

attachmentAssetMimeType.description: MIME type of the attachment asset.

attachmentAssetDirectoryPath.description: Directory path to the attachment asset.

quantityUnit.description: Unit of measure for minimumQuantity and maximumQuantity.

contractID.description: Contract identifier the offer price is associated with.

keyword.description: Search keywords for the catalog entity.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Structure containing the default content sequence values.

displaySequence.description: Sequence value of the default content.

resultFormat.description: Type of the result.  Valid values include MarketingContent, CatalogGroup, CatalogEntry.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.marketing.handler..description: Data to display in the e-marketing spot.

nextTimeLimit.description: The number of seconds from now to the earliest start date or end date of activities scheduled to the e-Marketing Spot.

marketingSpotIdentifier.description: The unique identifier of the e-marketing spot.

filteredResult.description: Result that was filtered from display in the e-Marketing Spot.

marketingSpotDataTitle.description: Marketing title to display in the e-marketing spot.

behavior.description: The current caching behavior of the e-marketing spot.

behaviorList.description: List of marketing tracking data for the storefront user

time.description: The time which the behavior was recorded
